messages.message:
**SOLVED**

is this a known issue/common issue? I OCR’d something with ABBYY, the text comes out like (in Refiner 5 text view)
```My first page
 Address 1                                                        Name
 123 Main St
 San Francisco, CA                                               John Smith
My second page
 Address 2                                            Name
 321 Main St
 New York City, NY                                    Your Name```
the ibdoc file has this (for second page)
```"text": "My second page\n Address 2                                            Name\n 321 Main St\n New York City, NY                                    Your Name",```
scan functions aren’t able to look for `label='Address 2'` but it succeeds with `label='Address2'`
can you send the link to where you’re testing this on instabase?

here’s a link to dogfood (i’m testing locally btw): https://dogfood.instabase.com/felicia/my-repo/fs/Instabase%20Drive/Scan%20Box%20-%20Multipage%20testing/out/s1_process_files/two_page_scan_box_test.pdf.ibdoc
i’m sure the ibdoc is the correct one (aka it’s the abbyy output) since I can tell from the separators
@Chetan i guess it does #falsealarm, but why didn’t it work before? is there some kind of caching happening?
Oh this might be the caching — if you reran the flow it might have still been using the old cached value
Maybe we should rename the “Reload Scripts” toggle to “Reload Files and Scripts” ? — that might have solved your problem
But that would mean the old file would have OCR’d as “Address2” I assume?
I definitely remember one of the OCR settings producing `Address2` , just not 100% sure which one it was and whether I ran it right before this one since I just picked back up my work on this
yea we should rename that erick. or maybe add another toggle for files?
